sentences.english: He appeared at the breakfast bleary-eyed and with a hangover.
sentences.chinese: 他喫早餐時兩眼模糊，宿醉未醒。

sentences.english: Even a hair of the dog didnt make him feel better.
sentences.chinese: 即使是再喝解宿醉的一杯酒，也不會使他覺得好些。

sentences.english: I often used to hang out in supermarkets.
sentences.chinese: 我去了墨西哥，還有點宿醉呢。

sentences.english: It takes the edge off my hangover, kicks up the dust of last night’s drunk and gives it life.
sentences.chinese: 宿醉勾了起來，昨晚已經塵埃落定的醉意又煥發生機。

sentences.english: It was about an hour later that the geese woke up. They had devastating hangovers.
sentences.chinese: 約莫一個鐘頭以後這些鵝醒了，宿醉得要死不活。

sentences.english: Here's a look at The Hangover Part II.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有一個宿醉第二部分看看。

sentences.english: Drunk in the last minute. Then meeting.
sentences.chinese: 上一秒宿醉，下一秒開會。

sentences.english: The people of Grasse awoke to a terrible hangover.
sentences.chinese: 格拉斯人彷彿宿醉醒來，頭痛如裂。

sentences.english: They woke up for breakfast next morning with a hangover and feeling groggy.
sentences.chinese: 他們次早醒來早餐，仍宿醉而頭腦模糊。
什麼？現在都十二點了。宿醉？

sentences.english: Dehydration is one of the main causes of your hangover symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 脫水是宿醉症狀的主要原因之一。

sentences.english: Some hair of the dog would probably make me feel better.
sentences.chinese: 來點解宿醉的酒或許可以讓我感覺好一些。

sentences.english: Your faith walks on broken glass, And the hangover doesn't pass.
sentences.chinese: 信仰行走在玻璃渣子之上，宿醉的糾灼依舊滿是肝腸。

sentences.english: Some of our worst hangovers can happen when we're traveling.
sentences.chinese: 我們旅行時可能會遭遇到最壞的宿醉經歷。

sentences.english: Hair of the dog is the belief that drinking more alcohol when you already have a hangover will make you feel better!
sentences.chinese: 這種說法是指宿醉時喝更多酒會讓你更好一點。

definition: fragment/piece/(of a film) to break in the middle of viewing
to premiere (a movie or TV show)/premiere (of a movie)/first-run (movie)/to greet (the eye) before anything else (e.g. when entering a room)
to wake up from a sleep
